text:
Not okay.

Sexism is so rife in Hollywood it hardly comes as a surprise when (yet another) male director is accused of something vile towards an aspiring female actress.

Well, this time (in the 1,347th edition of Sexism In Hollywood) it isn’t an aspiring actress making the claim, but Emmy Rossum — Golden Globe nominated Emmy Rossum.

“My agent called me and was like, ‘I’m so embarrassed to make this call, but there’s a big movie and they’re going to offer it to you. They really love your work on the show. But the director wants you to come into his office in a bikini. There’s no audition. That’s all you have to do,” Rossum said during a comedy roundtable hosted by The Hollywood Reporter.

The worst part — and likely the part every woman can relate to — was that Rossum didn’t immediately dismiss the offer, because of such an ingrained culture of sexism whereby attitudes and expectations are actually just pretty normal occurrences. Relate?

“And I actually had this moment like, ‘Well, how good is the part?’” Rossum said. “For a second, I was like, ‘Would I do it? Send me the script. Maybe the character is in a bikini in the movie.’”

But upon getting her hands on the script, Rossum was horrified to know that nope, there was no bikini scene, and actually no nudity at all.

“We really love your work, but we just want to see how tight your ass is,” Rossum said, mimicking the director’s voice. “Are you fucking kidding me? Last time I checked, I’m not a fucking model.”

Yeah, last time we checked a good bum might be a prerequisite for the Victoria’s Secret fashion show but definitely not for much else.
title: Emmy Rossum was asked to audition in a bikini for movie with no bikini scene
